definitions: To persuade someone to allow you to do something or to agree with you.
To deal with a problem or difficulty.
To avoid a rule, law, or problem.
To become known by many people (of news or information).
examples: She knows how to get round her dad.
We need to get round this issue quickly.
They found a way to get round the regulations.
News of the scandal soon got round.
I'll get round to your place later.
